intro: Gutierrezia globosa, commonly known as the globular goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, globular shape and dense foliage make it a distinctive feature in desert landscapes. Gutierrezia globosa is also valued for its role in stabilizing soils and supporting local wildlife.
